NPCResponse: Don't believe me, do you? No, poor Antonio, no one listens to his tall tales. \n\nMock me if it pleases you. But I wouldn't touch a coin of that treasure, not unless yer keen on eternal suffering.

Blackpowder called her something funny. Think, Antonio…Nerry? Nerry-id? Anyhow, he hates her something fierce, has most of his crew battering at her door. If yer fool enough to go after her, you'll have to get through HIM first.
Heh heh…eyes on the prize, young'un. Eyes on the prize. If anyone breaks that curse, I'll be out of here with as much gold as these old arms can carry.
Alas, no. My lady wants something, but no matter what I present to the door in offering, it refuses to budge. Perhaps I'm unworthy of such a wondrous creature…

You can tell a fishing hotspot is active when you see fish jumping out of it.
<img src="lyshineui/images/tooltipimages/fishinghotspotactive.png" height="188"></img>
While it's active, landing your cast within the hotspot will yield quicker bites and rarer fish. When you place your line correctly, you'll see a small alert telling you you've hit the hotspot.

After enough fish are caught at a hotspot it will become depleted. You can tell a hotspot is depleted when there are no fish jumping.
<img src="lyshineui/images/tooltipimages/fishinghotspotdepleted.png" height="188"></img>
A depleted hotspot will become active again after some time has passed.

As your fishing skill improves, you will be able to find more and better hotspots.
